column4: anybody have any experience recovering a lost partition from a drive that is failing?
I recovered mine from totally dead drive
luckily though, that was 'cause I was able to seek/skip past the failing blocks in dd
I understand if the drive isn't even viewable as a device, if you're out of other ideas *sometimes* freezing it can help
but if you're able to do dd - dump an image FIRST
well. maybe you just lost your partition table
you can recover lost partitions w/ gpart (not gparted)
well. maybe gparted too these days, who knows :)
before mucking about w/ the disc really grab an image first - or multiple images if your drive has sporadic failures
attempting fixes on a failing drive is pointless
if i grab the image i imagine i have to put it on a whole other drive or can i use free space on a drive i'm using?
ummm. whatever you do do NOT keep using the failing drive. period. fullstop
get another drive, ideally a much larger drive, do all your work there
the only other free drive i have is much smaller :(
drives are cheap these days
are bad sectors gonna be an issue when trying to get the image?
also what do i use to capture the image.. have any links?
quite possibly. might have to do seek/skip
you could try this ddrescue thing he mentioned, but I have no familiarity
dd if=/dev/sda of=rescueimage bs=16M
if it fails, make a note of where it fails, and seek/skip past it
might have to use bs closer to actual sector size if you get failures
